視線: one's line of sight, one's gaze, one's eyes (looking)
練る: to knead, to thicken into a paste (stirring over a flame), to polish (a plan, etc.)
一匹: one (small animal), two-tan bolt of cloth
船板塀: fence made from disused ship planks
徐々: slow, gradual, steady; calm, composed, relaxed
苛々: to get irritated, to get annoyed, to be on the edge
断る: to refuse, to reject, to dismiss
金蔵: treasure house, treasury; financial supporter, patron, financier, backer
急騰: sudden rise (in price), sharp rise, jump
賛否: yes and no, for and against
固まる: to harden, to solidify, to become firm
浮く: to float, to become merry, to be cheerful
駆除: extermination (of pests), eradication, stamping out (e.g. a social evil)
謙る: to deprecate oneself and praise the listener, to abase oneself
秋萩帖: Akihagijō (10C poem by Ono Michikaze, regarded as the first hiragana text)
寿司: sushi, range of dishes made with vinegared rice combined with fish, vegetables, egg, etc.
